startup

Class HospitalSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • startup.HospitalSystem

  • public class HospitalSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple hospital system with only one ward. Patients and doctors can be created, and patients assigned to a doctor and/or placed in a bed of the ward.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HospitalSystem() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDoctor()
      Read the information for a new doctor and then add the doctor to the dictionary of all doctors.
      void addPatient()
      Read the information for a new patient and then add the patient to the dictionary of all patients.
      void assignBed()
      Assign a patient to a specific bed.
      void assignDoctorToPatient()
      Assign a doctor to take care of a patient.
      void createWard()
      Create the ward after reading the information to initialize it.
      void displayEmptyBeds()
      Display the empty beds for the ward.
      void displaySystemState()
      Display system state.
      void dropAssociation()
      Drop the association between a doctor and a patient.
      void initialize()
      Initialize the system by creating the dictionaries, ward, and interface for I/O.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Run the hospital system.
      int readOpId()
      Output the prompt that lists the possible tasks, and read the selection chosen by the user.
      void releasePatient()
      Release a patient from the ward.
      void run()
      Run the hospital system: initialize, and then accept and carry out operations.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Return a String that contains all the patients and doctors in the system.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize the system by creating the dictionaries, ward, and interface for I/O.

      • createWard

        public void createWard()
        Create the ward after reading the information to initialize it.

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the hospital system: initialize, and then accept and carry out operations. Output the patient and doctor dictionaries, and the ward when finishing.

      • readOpId

        public int readOpId()
        Output the prompt that lists the possible tasks, and read the selection chosen by the user.
        Returns:
        the int corresponding to the task selected
